column1: 0030|Half-past twelve o’clock|Half-past twelve o’clock came; Turkey began to glow in the face
column3: and become generally obstreperous; Nippers abated down into quietude and courtesy; Ginger Nut munched his noon apple; and Bartleby remained standing at his window in one of his profoundest dead-wall reveries.

column1:
0030|half past midnight|“I love you more than you can possibly know.”
“I love you too.” I smile and his lips linger on my cheek. As he walks down the hall
column2: I note the time: half past midnight.

column1: 0030|half-past twelve|It was half-past twelve when I returned to the Albany as a last desperate resort. The scene of my disaster was much as I had left it. The baccarat-counters still strewed the table
column2: with the empty glasses and the loaded ash-trays. A window had been opened to let the smoke out
column3: and was letting in the fog instead.
